abstract: The Federal Trade Commission’s investigation of Google ramps up, and Newt Gingrich strings out the decision to end his campaign for the Republican presidential nomination.
snippet: The Federal Trade Commission’s investigation of Google ramps up, and Newt Gingrich strings out the decision to end his campaign for the Republican presidential nomination.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Trade Commission is hiring an experienced litigator as part of its antitrust investigation of Google and its search engine, David Streitfeld and Edward Wyatt report. The hiring of Beth A. Wilkinson, a former Justice Department prosecutor, is a strong indication that the government is considering taking the case to court, which would be the biggest government-tech industry showdown since the Microsoft case 14 years ago.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Google in the Spotlight, and New Yorker’s 2 Dots on Top
